duties_responsibilities.duty: Provides supervision to clinical staff. Provides individual, family, couple, or group therapy as indicated.
Effectively communicates with other mental health personnel regarding client needs.
Utilizes technology for timely record-keeping and report-writing.
Interfaces with other community agencies and resources to optimize service to mental health clients.
Exhibits leadership qualities and skills expected of a person in a supervisory position.
Provides mental health consultation to allied disciplines in the community.
Works closely with mental health management and personnel to create new client service programs and evaluate existing programs.
Identifies community resources and facilitates client referrals.
Serves as a liaison and resource to community agencies and area educators concerning persons with mental illness.
Oversees specific grants as assigned and completes necessary documentation according to grant requirements.

education_certification.credential: Master's degree in Counseling, Psychology, Social Work, or related field (Ph.D. or LCSW preferred)
